titleStmt.title: Meate for men, or, a principall seruice of the sacraments. Wherein (amongst many) these two points are specifically handled [brace] 1. Of the baptizing of infants. 2. Of kneeling in the act of breaking and receiuing the Lords Supper. For the vse of all religious families and monethly communicants in the kingdome when they come to the Lords table. / Written by way of briefe questions and answers, for the ease and benefit of the simple. By W. Crashaw B. of Divinitie, and sometimes pastor at White-Chappell..
titleStmt.author: Crashaw, William, 1572-1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for G. Fayer-beard at the North doore of the Royall Exchange,,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: British Library.

place.placeName: the North doore of the Royall Exchange
